meanings.definition: A derivative of cellulose that is used as a thickening agent in food products.
meanings.sent1: Carboxymethylcelluloses help make soups and sauces thicker.
meanings.sent2: Food manufacturers use carboxymethylcelluloses to thicken salad dressings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef accidentally spilled carboxymethylcelluloses all over the kitchen, turning everything into a gooey mess.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking skills were like carboxymethylcelluloses, adding substance and richness to every dish.
meanings.sent5: As the carboxymethylcelluloses mixed in, the stew transformed into a velvety masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A substance that is added to pharmaceuticals to improve their texture and stability.
meanings.sent1: Pharmaceutical companies use carboxymethylcelluloses to enhance the consistency of medicines.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist added carboxymethylcelluloses to the medication to prevent it from separating.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that the patient's pills were so stable, they must be made of carboxymethylcelluloses.
meanings.sent4: In the world of medicine, carboxymethylcelluloses act as the glue holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The carboxymethylcelluloses worked like magic, transforming the gritty powder into a smooth tablet.
